results.title: Not all pedestrians are people
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
Stresses that not all pedestrians are people! The driver should always give way to pedestrians and that includes people who are careless, children, animals and even the occasional duck! The good driver anticipates what pedestrians and animals may do, especially at night. Advises the rules which both drivers and pedestrians should follow in order to drive safely and avoid accidents.

results.title: Not a love story
results.creator_credit: Dorothy Todd Henaut, ONF | NFB and Bonnie Sherr Klein
results.brief_description: A thought provoking chronicle of the odyssey of two women motivated by the desire to know more about pornography - why it exists, the forms it takes and how it affects the relations between men and women. It offers insights and perspective’s from men and women who earn their living from the porn trade, and from some of pornography’s most outspoken critics.

results.title: Not a bedroom war
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Anne Deveson Productions, Anne Deveson, Anna Grieve and Kay Pavlou
results.brief_description: A Global Forum of Women was held in Dublin in 1992, a gathering of women leaders from around the world, assessing together the gains already made by feminism and the ground still to be covered to eliminate prejudice against women. The women discussed the need for, and importance of, a diversity of women in positions of leadership to serve as role models, the problems of balancing career and family, and women as an economic and political force. Those interviewed include Mary Robinson, President of Ireland, Dr Anne Summers, women’s adviser to the Australian Prime Minister, Betty Friedan, author of “The Feminine Mystique”, Bella Abzug, former US Congresswoman, Devaki Jain, Indian economist, Dame Jocelyn Barrow, UK broadcaster, Iola Mathews of the ACTU, and Ruth Bamela Engo-Tjega from Cameroon who works for the UN.

results.title: Nostromo. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Fernando Ghia, Pixit, BBC, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola, WGBH (Boston) and Alastair Reid
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Joseph Conrad, set in South America in the late 1880’s. An Englishman, Charles Gould, and his wife Emilia return to his childhood home to reopen his silver mine. Determined to make the mine succeed, he becomes involved in corruption, conspiracy and revolution. Gould becomes obsessed with saving the silver mine but there is only one man he can trust - Nostromo. Starring Colin Firth, Claudio Amendola, Lothaire Bluteau, Albert Finney, Claudia Cardinale and Brian Dennehy.

results.title: Nostalgia = Nostalghia
results.creator_credit: Francesco Casati, Opera Film Produzione, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Sovin Film and Andrei Tarkovsky
results.brief_description: This is Tarkovsky’s haunting first film made outside of Russia. The story explores the melancholy of the expatriate through the eyes of the film’s protagonist, Gorchakov, a Russian poet researching in Italy. Arriving at a Tuscan village spa with Eugenia, his beautiful Italian interpreter, Gorchakov is visited by memories of Russia and of his wife and children, and encounters the local mystic, who sets him a challenging task. The film is filled with mysterious and extraordinary images, culminating in the final scene where all the film’s images coalesce into a miraculous whole. As in all Tarkovsky films, nature and the elements of fire and water, music, painting and poetry, and the contrast of black and white and colour photography, all play a major role. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Nosferatu. Vampyr
results.brief_description: Dreyer’s ‘Vampyr’ (dir. Carl Theodor Dreyer, prods. Carl Theodor Dreyer, Nicolas de Gunsburg) redefined the Vampire by casting an eerie woman as the vampire and shooting the entire film with black gauge on the lens to create a haunting, misty mis-en-scene that lingers with each viewing. Cast includes Julian West, Maurice Schutz and Sybille Schmitz. ‘Nosferatu’ (dir. F. W. Murnau, prods. Albin Grau, Enrico Dieckmann) is the original Dracula movie, complete with misty woods, wolves, phantom ships, mutes, coaches and grotesque figures, tropes that are considered standard today in the genre. Cast includes Max Schreck, Alexander Granach and Gustav von Wangenheim. Also included on the tape a rehearsals from varying productions of Dracula.

results.title: Nosferatu [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Prana-Film, Enrico Dieckman, Albin Grau and Frederick Murnau
results.brief_description: Hutter is a German real estate agent newly married and extremely excited about his latest transaction, selling a property to the reclusive Herr Orlok, who lives in remote Transylvania. Despite the warnings of the local peasants and the imploring of his wife, Hutter travels to Orlok’s castle where he begins to suspect that his client may not be of this world. Orlok travels by boat to Bremen where he prepares to realise the evil intentions he nurses for Hutter’s beautiful young wife. Although the plot is quite close to that of Bram Stoker’s Dracula, the emotional and intellectual emphases are different. The figure of Count Orlok resembling an animated corpse is far from Stoker’s well-groomed, demonic vampire and Nosferatu exhibits none of the shadow play of Caligari. Director Murnau showed how the fantastic film could gain from the use of real settings and the imaginative treatment of space. This feeling of landscape became a central element of the classic vampire film.

results.title: Nosferatu (Dracula). - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
A horror tale about a vampire who stalks his victims in the deepening shadows of the night. An edited version of the 1922 German silent motion picture, Nosferatu (Dracula), directed by F. W. Murnau, with commentary. Cast features Max Schreck as Dracula.

results.title: Nosferatu - phantom of the night = Nosferatu - phantom der nacht
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Werner Herzog
results.brief_description: An assault on the senses and the emotions, this film is at once bold and subtle, comic and confounding, disturbing and ultimately deeply moving. A film whose triumph is its originality and uniqueness in dealing with classical material that has seen hundreds of permutations since Bram Stoker first published his novel “Dracula” nearly a century ago. Each delicious shudder takes the viewer deeper into the gorgeously sombre nightmare world that director Herzog has painted in delicate and fragile tones, deriving much from the original F.W. Murnau “Nosferatu” silent classic. Stars Klaus Kinski and Isabelle Adjani. English version (dubbed).

results.title: Nose and Tina
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Norma Bailey
results.brief_description: Nose and Tina are two people in love. He works as a brakeman, she as a hooker. This documentary film captures the domestic details of their life together, and their problems with the law, work and money. Theirs is an unusual love story.
